newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Stormy weather forces HK schools, courts to close.
newsitem.headline: Stormy weather forces HK schools, courts to close.

text.p: Stormy weather forced Hong Kong authorities to shut schools and some public institutions on Thursday, but the international airport stayed open.
The government issued a rainstorm danger warning and suspended classes in schools, along with court sessions, official statements said.
The Royal Obervatory's rainstorm warning came after more than 50 milimetres (two inches) of rain fell over the territory in one hour on Thursday morning.
There were no immediate reports of injuries or damage.
